speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, we are going to be in a period of morning business until 4:30 today, with Senators permitted to speak for up to 10 minutes each, the time equally divided and controlled between the two leaders or their designees. Senator Dorgan is controlling 30 minutes of the majority's time. Following morning business, the Senate will resume consideration of the motion to proceed to H.R. 2881, the Federal Aviation Administration Reauthorization. At 5:30 today there will be a cloture vote on the motion to proceed to that bill.

As a reminder to all Senators, Wednesday, at 11 a.m., there will be a joint meeting of Congress in the Hall of the House of Representatives, with the Prime Minister of Ireland, Bertie Ahern, presenting his statement to the country.
